title: Black Forest Cake II
description: Indulge in this classic Black Forest Cake, a luscious chocolate layer cake soaked in Kirsch liqueur and layered with sweet cherry filling and fluffy whipped cream. Perfectly moist and rich, it’s a show-stopping dessert that brings a touch of elegance and nostalgia to any celebration.
ingredients: 2 (14 ounce) cans pitted Bing cherries, drained
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottoms of two 8-inch round pans with parchment paper circles.
Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt; set aside.
Cream shortening and sugar together until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract until well combined.
Alternately beat in the flour mixture and buttermilk until just combined.
Pour batter evenly into the prepared pans.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool cakes completely, then remove parchment paper.
Cut each cake layer in half horizontally to create 4 layers total.
Sprinkle each layer generously with 1/2 cup kirschwasser to soak.
In a medium bowl, cream butter until light and fluffy.
Add confectioners' sugar, a pinch of salt, and brewed coffee; beat until smooth. If too thick, add a few teaspoons of cherry juice or milk.
Spread one-third of the buttercream filling on the first cake layer, then top with one-third of the drained cherries. Repeat for remaining layers.
In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks.
Beat in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon kirschwasser.
Frost the top and sides of the assembled cake with the whipped cream mixture.
Use a potato peeler to shave curls from the semisweet chocolate square and sprinkle over the cake as garnish.
tips: For the richest flavor, use fresh Bing cherries if possible and chill your mixing bowls before whipping the cream to achieve perfect stiff peaks. Avoid overbaking the cake to keep it moist and tender. When slicing layers, use a serrated knife and a gentle sawing motion for clean cuts.

structured_content.content: This Black Forest Cake is a decadent celebration of chocolate and cherries, soaked in fragrant Kirsch liqueur that infuses every bite with a subtle cherry warmth. The layers of moist cake, luscious cherry filling, and fluffy whipped cream create a symphony of textures and flavors that make this dessert truly special.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 1 hour 10 minutes active time
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for celebrations, holiday dinners, and special occasions
  • Uses simple pantry staples and canned cherries for convenience
  • Elegant presentation with chocolate curls that impress guests

structured_content.content: I first made this cake for a family birthday and was amazed at how the Kirsch added a sophisticated cherry note that elevated the classic chocolate cake. It quickly became a beloved tradition, bringing smiles and sweet memories to every gathering.

• Main ingredient: High-quality cocoa powder and all-purpose flour ensure a tender, rich cake; be sure to sift to avoid lumps.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Kirschwasser adds authentic cherry flavor and depth; vanilla extract enhances sweetness and aroma.
  • Supporting ingredients: Buttermilk keeps the cake moist and tender; heavy cream whips into a light, fluffy frosting.
  • Equipment needed: Two 8-inch round cake pans, parchment paper, electric mixer, serrated knife, and a potato peeler for chocolate curls.

Preparation:
Preheat oven and prepare pans with parchment for easy removal. Sift dry ingredients to ensure even mixing. Cream shortening and sugar until fluffy for a light cake texture.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Alternate adding dry ingredients and buttermilk to maintain batter consistency. Bake until a toothpick comes out clean, indicating perfect doneness. Cool completely before slicing layers.
Finishing Touches:
Soak layers with Kirschwasser for moistness and flavor. Layer with buttercream and cherries, then frost with whipped cream infused with vanilla and Kirsch. Garnish with delicate chocolate curls for a stunning finish.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Use room temperature ingredients for smooth batter and even baking
  • Don’t overbake to keep the cake moist and tender
  • Look for a clean toothpick test and springy cake surface as doneness cues
  • Store covered in the refrigerator; best enjoyed within 2 days. Reheat slices briefly at room temperature for best flavor.

structured_content.content: Sharing this cake with loved ones always brings joy and warmth, reminding me of festive moments and the simple pleasure of homemade desserts that bring everyone together.

Enhance the cherry flavor by adding a touch of cherry jam between layers or sprinkle toasted almonds for crunch. Experiment with a splash of espresso in the batter to deepen the chocolate notes or swap Kirsch with raspberry liqueur for a fruity twist.

Serve slices with fresh cherries or a scoop of vanilla ice cream for an indulgent treat. Pair with a glass of sparkling wine or coffee to complement the rich chocolate and cherry flavors. Ideal for holiday dinners, birthdays, or elegant afternoon tea.

For a gluten-free version, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free baking mix. Vegan adaptations can use plant-based butter, egg replacers, and coconut cream for frosting. Try layering with fresh berries instead of canned cherries for a lighter, seasonal take.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Chill cake layers before slicing to achieve clean, even cuts
  • Beat buttercream until light and fluffy for smooth spreading
  • Whip cream in a chilled bowl to reach stiff peaks quickly
  • Use a potato peeler on cold chocolate for delicate, elegant curls

structured_content.content: With this recipe in your kitchen arsenal, you’ll confidently create a stunning Black Forest Cake that delights both the eyes and palate, making every occasion feel extra special and delicious.
